abstract: A crush of shoppers tore down the front doors and thronged into a store in suburban New York, killing a temporary employee.
snippet: A crush of shoppers tore down the front doors and thronged into a store in suburban New York, killing a temporary employee.
lead_paragraph: The throng of Wal-Mart shoppers had been building all night, filling sidewalks and stretching across a vast parking lot at the Green Acres Mall in Valley Stream, N.Y. At 3:30 a.m., the Nassau County police had to be called in for crowd control, and an officer with a bullhorn pleaded for order.

headline.print_headline: A Crowd Seeking Holiday Deals, and a Rush for the Door That Turned Fatal

byline.original: By Robert D. McFadden and Angela Macropoulos
